priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Crohn's Disease Findings About Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C174224

self.title: CDISC SDTM Crohn's Disease Findings About Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test names that describe findings about Crohn's Disease event or intervention.
name: Crohn's Disease Findings About Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Crohn's Disease Findings About Test Name Terminology
synonyms: Crohn's Disease Findings About Test Name

terms.definition: The age at which illness-specific symptoms first began.
The anatomical location of the lesion that has been determined to be the primary lesion.
An indication as to whether a biopsy specimen was collected.
An indication as to whether the subject has been on a treatment regimen which, based on defined criteria, is expected to be efficacious.
A description of the relative amount of tissue, blood vessel, or organ that has been removed.
A determination of the final amount of a substance taken as a dose by a subject.
A classification based on the anatomical location(s) of the fistula.
A determination of how often a subject takes a substance at the final dose amount.
A determination of how often a subject takes a substance at the maximum dose amount.
An indication as to whether the ileocecal junction was removed.
A measurement of the total length of the removed tissue, blood vessel, or organ.
The longest diameter of the lesion that has been determined to be the primary lesion.
A determination of the maximum amount of a substance taken as a dose by a subject.
The number of abscesses observed.
The total number of biopsy specimens collected.
The number of devices inserted into an individual.
A determination of the number of devices within a subject.
The number of fistulas observed.
The number of lesions observed.
The number of procedures performed on or in an individual.
The number of anatomical strictures observed.
A description of the appearance of the anatomical site from which a biopsy specimen has been collected.
An indication as to whether an individual has had a relapse after discontinuation of a substance due to dependence.
terms.preferredTerm: Relapse after Discontinuation Because of Dependence Indicator

terms.definition: The degree of something undesirable.
The signs and/or symptoms that result in the discontinuation of treatment or intervention.
terms.preferredTerm: Sign or Symptom Leading to Discontinuation

terms.definition: An indication as to whether an individual has become dependent on a substance.
An indication as to whether an individual is unable to discontinue the use of a substance due to dependence.
terms.preferredTerm: Unable to Discontinue Use Due to Dependence Indicator

terms.definition: An indication as to whether an individual is incapable of reducing or tapering the amount of a substance taken due to dependence.
